page.title: 10Energy
page.content: The area has an electricity supply and all houses are connected to it. There is no gas supply although a mains pipe runs through the area and there is a pumping station. There are weekly deliveries of bottled gas used for gas fires and some houses have gas central heating. Many houses have reverted to using wood with the popularity of the new wood stoves. Coal is delivered weekly if needed. Many houses have Rayburns, Agas, or similar stoves, fuelled by coal. Oil for cooking and central heating is delivered regularly with depots in the main towns around. The nearest petrol stations are in Bishops Frome and Bromyard, the only petrol station in the area having closed since the war. The area is well supplied providing the roads are not blocked with snow. Everyone needs to keep good supplies in the winter.
